com.snowtide.pdf.lucene

Class LucenePDFConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snowtide.pdf.lucene.LucenePDFConfiguration

  • public class LucenePDFConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class are used to control the creation of Lucene Documents from PDF content through the LucenePDFDocumentFactory class.
    Version:
    Â©2004-2014 Snowtide, http://snowtide.com, licensed under MIT. See LICENSE in the top level of the lucene-pdf project directory.
    See Also:
    Indexing PDF Documents with Lucene and PDFxStream for usage details

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_MAIN_TEXT_FIELD_NAME
      The default name assigned to the Lucene Field containing the main body of text extracted from a PDF file: "text".

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MAIN_TEXT_FIELD_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_MAIN_TEXT_FIELD_NAME
        The default name assigned to the Lucene Field containing the main body of text extracted from a PDF file: "text".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LucenePDFConfiguration

        public LucenePDFConfiguration(java.lang.String mainTextFieldName)
        Creates a new config object. The resulting object retains the default configuration except for the name assigned to the Lucene Field that contains the main PDF text content.
        Parameters:
        mainTextFieldName - - the name that should be assigned to Fields containing the main PDF text content.

      • LucenePDFConfiguration

        public LucenePDFConfiguration()
        Creates a new config object. Fields containing the main text content of PDF documents converted into Lucene Documents will be assigned a default name. Other configuration defaults are as follows:
        • All PDF metadata attributes are copied to the resulting Lucene documents
        • The main text content is tokenized and indexed, but not stored
        • The PDF metadata attributes are tokenized, stored, and indexed.

    • Method Detail

      • setBodyTextFieldName

        public void setBodyTextFieldName(java.lang.String bodyTextFieldName)
        Sets the name that will be assigned to Lucene Fields containing PDF body text content.

      • getBodyTextFieldName

        public java.lang.String getBodyTextFieldName()
        Returns the name that will be assigned to Lucene Fields containing PDF body text content.

      • getMetadataFieldMapping

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadataFieldMapping()
        Returns a copy of the mapping between PDF metadata attributes and the names given to Lucene fields created for them.

      • getMetadataFieldMapping

        public java.lang.String getMetadataFieldMapping(java.lang.String pdfMetadataAttr)
        Returns the name that should be given to Lucene Fields created from the value of the named PDF metadata attribute.

      • setMetadataFieldMapping

        public void setMetadataFieldMapping(java.lang.String pdfMetadataAttr,
                                    java.lang.String fieldName)
        Sets the name that will be assigned to Lucene Fields corresponding to the provided PDF metadata attribute name (e.g. Document.ATTR_AUTHOR, etc).

      • copyAllPDFMetadata

        public boolean copyAllPDFMetadata()
        Returns true if any PDF metadata attributes not explicitly mapped will be added to generated Lucene Documents using their names as specified in the source PDFs.

      • setCopyAllPDFMetadata

        public void setCopyAllPDFMetadata(boolean b)
        See Also:
        copyAllPDFMetadata()

      • setBodyTextSettings

        public void setBodyTextSettings(boolean store,
                                boolean index,
                                boolean token)
        Sets Field attributes that will be used when creating the Field object for the main text content of a PDF document. These attributes correspond to the store, index, and token parameters of the Field constructor before Lucene v4.x and the same-named attributes of FieldType afterwards.

      • setMetadataSettings

        public void setMetadataSettings(boolean store,
                                boolean index,
                                boolean token)
        Sets Field attributes that will be used when creating Field objects for the document attributes found in a PDF document. These attributes correspond to the store, index, and token parameters of the Field constructor before Lucene v4.x and the same-named attributes of FieldType afterwards.

      • indexBodyText

        public boolean indexBodyText()
        Returns true if the main body text of PDFs added to Lucene Documents created through LucenePDFDocumentFactory using this config object will be indexed.

      • storeBodyText

        public boolean storeBodyText()
        Returns true if the main body text of PDFs added to Lucene Documents created through LucenePDFDocumentFactory using this config object will be stored.

      • tokenizeBodyText

        public boolean tokenizeBodyText()
        Returns true if the main body text of PDFs added to Lucene Documents created through LucenePDFDocumentFactory using this config object will be tokenized.

      • indexMetadata

        public boolean indexMetadata()
        Returns true if the PDF metadata attributes added Lucene Documents created through LucenePDFDocumentFactory using this config object will be indexed.

      • storeMetadata

        public boolean storeMetadata()
        Returns true if the PDF metadata attributes added Lucene Documents created through LucenePDFDocumentFactory using this config object will be stored.

      • tokenizeMetadata

        public boolean tokenizeMetadata()
        Returns true if the PDF metadata attributes added Lucene Documents created through LucenePDFDocumentFactory using this config object will be tokenized.
